newsitem.title: BULGARIA: New investor gets seat on Bulgarian Inv Bank board.
newsitem.headline: New investor gets seat on Bulgarian Inv Bank board.

text.p: Bulgarian Investment Bank (BIB) shareholders elected a new board member from the Nicosia-based Commercial Ventures Ltd, which plans to acquire 11.12 percent in BIB, a BIB official said on Tuesday.
"Aristos Doxiadis was elected member of the board of directors to represent Commercial Ventures, replacing Joaquin Gefaell de la Pena of the EBRD on the board," the official told Reuters.
The BIB was the first bank investment project in Bulgaria of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), which holds 35 percent of the bank.
The BIB was set up three years ago, with capital of 450 million levs which now is being raised to 2.2 billion levs to meet the central bank's minumum capital requirement for a full licence.
Bulgaria's central bank on June 12 allowed Commercial Ventures Ltd to acquire 11.12 percent of BIB voting shares under the capital rise.
The bank also allowed the Commercial Bank of Greece to raise its stake in the BIB to 20.625 percent from its current 17.676 percent.
Other BIB shareholders include Legist Jersey Trustees Ltd, Banque Nationale de Paris, United Bulgarian Bank, and Bulgaria's Biochim Bank.
